meanings.definition: To have excessive or unrealistic expectations.
meanings.sent1: She overhopes for a perfect score on every test.
meanings.sent2: He always overhopes for things to go exactly as planned.
meanings.sent3: Sarah overhopes for her cat to start talking one day.
meanings.sent4: His overhopes soared higher than the tallest mountain.
meanings.sent5: Their overhopes danced like colorful butterflies in the wind.

meanings.definition: To desire or wish for something too strongly.
meanings.sent1: The child overhopes for a new toy every time they pass a store.
meanings.sent2: She overhopes for a sunny day to have a picnic.
meanings.sent3: He overhopes for a magical unicorn to appear in his backyard.
meanings.sent4: Their overhopes burned like a fierce flame in their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The overhopes in her eyes shone brighter than the stars in the sky.
